name: The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If driving there, you go off highway PR 3 which is a typical highway like any in the U.S. Stores, malls, gas stations etc. You turn left off PR3 onto a side road that goes through a mid to low income little community and follow through a cattle ranch about 1-2 miles. You then reach a 1/2 mile stretch that is tree lined and enter the St. Regis/resort area. I could not believe the property, just absolutely beautiful. The service provided by everyone is NUMBER 1 in my book. The pool, beach, and views stunning. I will be going back for sure.
reviews.title: OMG - The best resort in Puerto Rico

reviews.text: We ate dinner only once at the resort (Molassess - Excellant) its very expensive but we had a car and were able to find local restaurants close by that provided great local fare and very reasonable prices. If you pushed your budget to go to this resort and need to save a few bucks. Stock up on beer and drinks at Ralph's (nearby off PR3). We had an ocean front upgrade because it was off season and the second floor balcony was a great place for cocktails and pickies after a day at the beach or pool. I play golf but the course is very expensive. I played at Rio Mar Ocean Course a couple of times and less than half the price and it was very nice. If going to El Yunque, you are about 1/2 hour to 40 minutes away but be prepared for rain and long hilly walks. FYI - $22 a day valet for a bringing a car, mandatory.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Puerto Rico.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The experience here was outstanding. It is one of the best resort experiences I have ever had. The prices a very expensive on everything. You are limited on where you can eat but the food is pretty good. The resort is small where you can enjoy and feel like you are not overwhelmed by people. I would definitely go back. Great for couples or families.
reviews.title: Second time is as charming as the first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would like to extend our sincere gratitude to all of the St. Regis staff for a very special day and experience. Due to a combination of the impeccable grounds and the people of the St. Regis Bahia Beach, my fiancee chose this spot for a very special event in our lives - getting engaged! While all of the staff was extremely helpful and courteous throughout our stay, there are a few in particular who went above and beyond that we would like to mention:
reviews.title: SPECTACULAR

reviews.text: Concierge Desk: Rosie, Christine, and Didi
reviews.title: Abismal Service; Beautiful Locale

reviews.text: Took my wife and 2 year old to spend a few days in this beautiful resort. The property is surrounded by the tropical florest, and the rooms are located throughout independent 2 story buildings connected by a wooden walkway.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good quiet beach and beautiful landscape. Very limited breakfast menu options.

reviews.text: The rooms are large and the bathroom is huge, but had to change rooms three times. If you are travelling with children and need to have stroller access, make sure to request a room with elevator access. The first floor room did not work for us as its balcony was not gated, meaning that our 2 year old could have ran out to the florest directly from our room. Therefore I recommend second level apartments with elevator access.
reviews.title: Secluded, Amazing Rooms, Gorgeous Grounds

reviews.text: In terms of food selection, the property has three restaurants, and we have tried all of them. Restaurant Fern, was our first stop as we have been at several Jean-Georges restaurants before and we really enjoyed his style. The service was great but we expected more from our dining experience, for example the seasonings of the octopus were over powering and their breakfast menu selection was extremely limited and no other restaurant at the resort served breakfast.
reviews.title: The BEST PLACE EVER!!!!!

reviews.text: The restaurant by the pool took a really long time to execute our order, and the food arrived cold. The menu for lunch contained more sandwiches, salads, pizzas and appetizers but it did not offer entrees with fish and/or meat.
reviews.title: OMG - Perfection in EVERY way!!!

reviews.text: The Molasses restaurant by the golf course, had an excellent service and the dinner menu offered a good selection. The seasoning, presentation, temperature and taste was good.
reviews.title: A Birthday Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished a 2 night/3 day stay here, and had a great time. I agree with much said in previous reviews, though our experience was different in several respects.
reviews.title: Luxurious, well maintained resort with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property itself is beautiful, well maintained, modern and luxurious. The property is only 2 years old and has been kept up well. This extends to both the public areas and the rooms, which were very nice, comparable to a Four Seasons or the better St. Regis properties elsewhere in the world. The pool was particularly nice; in contrast to many luxury properties in the Caribbean, there were more than enough chairs for all the guests, and it never felt crowded. Food at the restaurants was consistently good, though not outstanding.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest difference we noticed, relative to other reviews, was in the service, which was consistently excellent. Calling for any kind of help, the phone was answered on the first ring and the services requested (for example, making up the room) were delivered promptly. Restaurant service was efficient, professional, and friendly. We never waited long for anything – and we had a number of meals while we were there (3 lunches, 2 breakfasts, and 2 dinners). Food prices are high, but no worse than other comparable properties.
reviews.title: Perfect, quick getaway

reviews.text: The beach was probably the weakest part of the property, as others have noted. It is fine, but certainly not outstanding in any way, and does have an inordinate amount of debris if you walk more than a minute or two in either direction from the entrance. The other irritating issue is that they charge $35 to use the facilities at the spa (steam room, sauna, Jacuzzi). Most other luxury properties let guests use these facilities free of charge.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort & Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, we would happily return. It is a great destination for a long weekend from anywhere on the east coast that has nonstop flights to San Juan. You can leave at a reasonable hour in the morning and be at the pool by mid-afternoon, then get in most of a day before going home. I recommend it highly.
reviews.title: A True Oasis in Paradise! It Just Doesn't Get Any Better Than This!

reviews.text: The good: The setting is beautiful, the grounds, gardens etc. The staff is extremely polite. The bad: Fern restaurant which is the flagship "dining experience" at best is horrible. They are clueless. The food is mediocre (and i'm being generous) and service in non-existent. Our party consisted of 12. Every meal came out at a different time and 3 were sent back. Unfortunately apologies do not solve the problem. The other restaurants were plagued with the same problem - poor service.
reviews.title: The Good and Unfortunately the very Bad

reviews.text: Make sure u are aware of the "hotel fee". That too is a joke. If you're playing golf, bring your own bug spray because they will charge you for a can.
reviews.title: Excellent location , excellent place but very poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever there was an opportunity for a "subtle" charge it was there.
reviews.title: A+ The BEst Hotel Ever in PR.

reviews.text: General manage was extremely nice and listened to our complaints. She credited us for the meal at Fern.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing, beautiful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice, for the money this place charges, you can do a lot better elsewhere.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property for Quiet Relaxation

aka: The St. Regis Bahia Beach Hotel Rio Grande
description: Designated as Puerto Rico’s first and only AAA Five Diamond resort and the leader in luxury on the island and in the Caribbean, The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort, Puerto Rico has been designed with the entire family in mind, providing a variety of extraordinary services and activities that will keep all guests entertained from sunrise to sunset. Located on a former 483 acre coconut plantation, it is nestled between El Yunque National Forest and the sparkling Atlantic Ocean on the northeast coast of Puerto Rico. Certified Gold Audubon Signature Sanctuary, the lush Resort features a tennis center, a golf course designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr., as well as 4 miles of nature trails, 70 acres of lakes and a boat house for water sports. The intimate St. Regis Bahia Beach boasts 139 rooms including 35 suites, where The St. Regis’ iconic Butler service is available. Most of the guestrooms overlook amazing ocean and garden views setting a new standard in luxury accommodations, service levels and facilities for the Caribbean. An indulging Remède Spa and the exquisite dining options will delight all senses, including Fern Restaurant, featuring culinary creations by world famous Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten, Molasses Restaurant, St. Regis Bar and Seagrapes. In addition, abundant banquet space is available to accommodate a variety of outdoor or indoor events. Featuring amazing ocean or garden views, it is the perfect setting for small or big gatherings as well as weddings. The elegant tropical magnificence of The St. Regis Bahia Beach creates a world for its guests that they will never want to leave.
